title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Family Services in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Pretty bad. Interviewer arrived 20 minutes late, didn't seem to care. Tone was dry and unfriendly. They posted on the website it was remote but it was a lie because it was really a hybrid postion.
Interview Questions: Do you have Spanish speaking abilities?

title: Individual/ Family Counselor  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Center for Family Services (Voorhees, NJ) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Virtual, easy questions pertaining to the job and your experience. Truly looked over your resume and asked fact finding questions and well as behavior based questions. Normal questions nothing outside of a normal interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? And why Family Services?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Family Services (Voorhees, NJ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and all questions asked during the interview about company culture were addressed and answered authentically. It appears that the agency values transparency and team work.
Interview Questions: The interview was more of a conversation and as the prospective candidate, I had many questions. Each question was answered thoughtfully. I think this dynamic led to less questioning by the person interviewing.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Family Services
Interview Descriptions: A fairly easy interview process included 2 rounds with more personable and team-based questions. One was over the phone and the other was through a video call with a couple of members of the program. They were easy to talk to, made sure I was ok with the set-up, and were interested in my motivation to work at a nonprofit.
Interview Questions: What are important skills that can improve community relationships?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Family Services
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed through a hiring event through Indeed. The interview was online over video call. The interviewer was very personable and welcoming. They were warm and polite which serves as a wonderful representation of the organization.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this company?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Family Services (Laurel Springs, Camden, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It was a very simple process to start, I applied through employee referral and filled out a paper application.  I was interviewed by the Program Director at the program and was hired on the spot. The longest part is everything after that. The motor vehicle, background check, and fingerprint check take weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working with children or youth?

title: Program Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Family Services (Camden, NJ) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Had brief phone interview then in-person interview.  The interview seemed to go well but I never heard back from the interviewer.  I even reached out to the interviewer and she never replied.  I believe if someone takes the time to come to an interview (taking time from current job, arranging childcare, etc)  that the professional and courteous thing to do is to at least let them know they did not get the position.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Family Services (Voorhees, NJ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was able to speak with 2 managers/ staff. Lots of experience questions and scenarios to go through.  They explained the job well and left time for a lot of questions.
Interview Questions: To tell me about my experience with youth

title: PR Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Family Services in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied in November and received an email back requesting a phone interview in early December.  After the phone interview, I was asked to come in for an in-person interview that same week.  About 2 weeks later I was asked to complete a writing test.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at Center for Family Services?
What qualities do you bring that will enhance the CFS team?
What are some of your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Family Services
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received phone call, came in for interview, met with two supervisors, shadowed case manager for a day, excessive reference-check, expressed continued interest, offered position, started the next week.  It all took about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions; Laid-back, comfortable; Be honest

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Family Services
Interview Descriptions: Fist interview was great..normal process.  Second interview was conducted in a group setting with myself and three other employees, Director, admin. assist., and receptionist.  was nervous at first, but overall it went well!
Interview Questions: Please try to be as detailed as possible regarding the technical question, business case, etc.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Center for Family Services (Williamstown, NJ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was rather easy. I had two interviews, the second interview I was offered the position and I completed a bunch of paperwork.  I was told I would need to complete a drug screening and attend a new hire meeting before I began work.
